title: Unprocessed Red Meat and Processed Meat Consumption

Guyatt, MDMcMaster University, Hamilton, Ontario, Canada (D.Z., G.H.G.)Search for more papers by this authorAuthor, Article, and Disclosure Informationhttps://doi.org/10.7326/L20-0126 SectionsAboutFull TextPDF ToolsAdd to favoritesDownload CitationsTrack CitationsPermissions ShareFacebookTwitterLinkedInRedditEmail IN RESPONSE:We share Dr. Meyer's environmental concerns but have a different perspective on the role of individual autonomy in the shared decision-making process and in the role of a guideline panel. Guideline panel members should be fully informed of the best available evidence on all the issues related to their recommendations. In our guideline, we exclusively assessed the relationship between meat and health outcomes. Producing recommendations on meat that take into account environmental concerns would require knowledge of the relative contribution to climate change of meat consumption compared with other factors. Such knowledge would require systematic reviews of the ...References1. Dedios MC, Esperato A, De-Regil LM, et al. Johnston, Bala, Alonso-Coello, and Guyatt are members of the GRADE working group. Their guideline on red and processed meat was unfunded. As part of his recent recruitment to Texas A&M University, Dr. Johnston receives funds from Texas A&M AgriLife Research to support investigator-initiated research related to saturated and polyunsaturated fats. Support from Texas A&M AgriLife institutional funds comes from interest and investment earnings, not a sponsoring organization, industry, or company. Dr. Johnston also received funding in 2015 (outside the 36-month International Committee of Medical Journal Editors reporting period) from the International Life Science Institute (North America) to assess the methodologic quality of guidelines addressing sugar intake by using internationally accepted GRADE and Appraisal of Guidelines for Research and Evaluation guideline standards. The authors of the study on sugar guidelines conducted the study independently without involvement of the funding source.Disclosures: Disclosures can be viewed at www.acponline.org/authors/icmje/ConflictOfInterestForms.do?msNum=L20-0126.
